channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: South Korea’s president, describing opposition as ‘anti-state forces’, declares martial law
item.description: President Yoon Suk Yeol said the step was necessary to protect the country from "communist forces" amid parliamentary wrangling over a budget bill.

item.title: Amid Syria’s Rebel Offensive, a Geopolitical Cauldron Simmers
item.description: Iran and Russia, both stretched by conflicts of their own, have experienced setbacks in Syria after a rebel offensive in the northwest of the country.

item.title: Earn $800,000? You Might Get Financial Aid at an Elite N.Y.C. School.
item.description: The average tuition of $65,000 a year at private schools has separated New York’s truly rich, who can afford to pay full tuition, from its merely weal...

item.title: Syria Fighting Worsens Already Dire Conditions in Idlib and Aleppo

item.title: The Great Pause for hiring frustrates 3 in 4 weary job seekers: ‘Like throwing a resume into a black box’
item.description: Job seekers go a year without an interview, navigating a cold hiring market

item.title: Martial Law Declared in South Korea: What to Know
item.description: President Yoon Suk Yeol has been locked in a bitter fight with the opposition, which controls Parliament

item.title: Jurors Set to Weigh Daniel Penny’s Fate in Choking Case That Divided New York
item.description: Prosecutors in Daniel Penny’s manslaughter trial finished closing arguments Tuesday. The trial has touched on fears about crime and the city’s failure...

item.title: Super Micro whistleblower doubles down on claim he was fired for complaining about accounting practices at the $20 billion tech giant
item.description: The company has denied allegations of improprieties and given its accounting a clean bill of health.

item.title: Live Updates: South Korean Lawmakers Vote to Defy President, Demanding an End to Martial Law
item.description: President Yoon Suk Yeol announced the extraordinary move amid a bitter fight with the political opposition, and protesters clashed with police outside...

item.title: Talks of Donald Trump Jr. joining the board of a little-known company minutes away from Mar-a-Lago just doubled its stock price
item.description: Trump Jr. could reportedly join the board as early as Tuesday.

item.title: YSL Trial Ends With Final Defendants Acquitted of Murder and Gang Charges
item.description: The winding, yearslong case against the star Atlanta rapper Young Thug, who recently pleaded guilty to gang charges, and five others concluded on Tues...

item.title: Amid Syria’s Rebel Offensive, a Geopolitical Cauldron Simmers
item.description: Iran and Russia, both stretched by conflicts of their own, have experienced setbacks in Syria after a rebel offensive in the northwest of the country.
